name: Introduction to Art History
description: This course provides an introduction to the history of art in the Western world, from the Middle Ages to the present day, and to the methods, techniques, and theories of art history.

name: Survey of Modern Art
description: This course focuses on the art of the 19th and 20th centuries, including the art of the avant-garde movements and the development of modern art in the United States.

name: Modern Art Theory and Criticism
description: This course explores the critical and theoretical foundations of modern art, including the emergence of modernist and postmodernist art and the role of theory and criticism in understanding modern art.

name: Modern Art and Society
description: This course examines the role of modern art in the social, historical, and political contexts of the 19th and 20th centuries, focusing on the relationship between art and society.
